roleset.name: cause a dependency, as to a drug
roleset.note: ADDICT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls addict-96. (from addict.01-v)
ADDICTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry addict.01. Framed by Anwen Feb 2011 (from addiction.01-n)
ADDICTED-J NOTES: Adjective based on WSJ, BOLT-4,5. Corresponds to VNcls addict-96. (from addicted.01-j)

roles.note: The causer role is rare with the verb, and doesn't seem grammatical with the adjective, but is there for symmetry in case it can occur. (from addicted.01-j)

example.name: basic passive
example.text: The efforts to get to the people who [*T*-3] are addicted, try to rehabilitate them;...

example.name: nice small clause
example.text: When you do that you wipe out the criminal incentives, including, I might say, the incentive that the drug pushers have to go around and get kids-1 addicted *trace*-1, so that they create a market for themselves.

example.name: all args
example.text: John addicted Mary to the joys of chocolate cake.
example.arg: to the joys of chocolate cake

example.name: Arg1 and Arg2
example.text: Will not prescribe hydrocodone due to the patient's pain killer addiction.

example.name: Sad, real example
example.text: hello , i am a 12 year old girl -LRB- 13 in two days -RRB- who-1 *T*-1 is addicted to self harming.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: She was addicted to it by the end of her hospitalization and continued to take it.
example.arg: by the end of her hospitalization

roleset.name: causing addiction
roleset.note: ADDICTIVE-J NOTES: Roleset based on P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from addictive.01-j)

example.name: Arg 0 only

example.name: Both args
example.text: Everything is addictive to me but tattoos are addictive to all.
